title: About Poppy's ultimate
body:
People think it's toxic, but couldn't simple changes be made?

Like why can't it be changed so she'd be immune from any form of CC from other people other than her target as well as taking reduced damage (30/40/50%?)

I mean, Idk, but that seems a way to balance it out.

replies.body:
Her old ultimate is not staying sorry to say. There is something to be said for how unique it is but the amount of frustration/confusion/abusive edge cases that it adds to the game outweighs the amount of fun/interesting gameplay that it brings. 

Hopefully the new ult we have in the works will be much more exciting and interesting while not bringing with it so many negative costs. Wait and see just a short while longer and let us know what you think of it when it's done.

Thats surprising to hear to be honest. I was thinking you would keep something in her current kit like you did Sion, and I thought it would be her most iconic ability right now (her ultimate).

But, I can see where you're coming from. And who knows, her wall bash might be more iconic than her ultimate.
we're keeping a few other things from her current kit (E being a big one, also her "low health tankiness").
Her current passive is very frustrating. It makes her almost immune to burst so will you make it so that she is tankier when low or still the same passive?
We'll be replacing Poppy's passive. We are thinking about keeping a ittle bit of 'tough when low on health' on the kit though, just in a much more apparent and balanceable way.
To me she's this little tenacious yordle ball of hate, will that still be present or is she becoming just another bruiser?

We're aiming to preserve her personality - determined, heroic, sincere etc. 

Must admit 'ball of hate' isn't the vibe I get off Poppy at present, 'ball of stubborness', 'ball of determination', 'ball of smash' and so on being the sort of stuff I associate with Poppy. Curious as to other people's thoughts though as to which few words you'd use to sum up Poppy's personality overall?
ball of "OH GOD WHY WON"T YOU JUST DIE ALREADY"

I feel like Poppy's core is that she won't let pain stop her. She just keeps going, no matter what you try to do to stop her (much like how she continued her father's work and delivered Jarvan's crown after he was slain). This worked out decently with her ulti--"I am coming for you and nothing is going to stop me." I am curious to see how you reimagine it, though. Tryndamere and Kayle already have the market on the invulnerability ult, and Irelia and Olaf have the CC reduction.

I think so long as something in the kit preserves the panic that sets in when Poppy ults, it'll be okay. Her personality is best shown through from the reactions of the enemy team. They need to have a mass "oh shit" reaction when Poppy ults. Something of a controlled panic, because they know they have to stop her but it's not going to be easy.

What if her ult translated this into something of a scaling threat issue? Say, when she ults, she gets a buff that increases her movement speed, tenacity, AD, AP, and damage reduction by a small amount for a period of time, but then have those values go up every time she's crowd-controlled during the ult? Or rather, every quarter-second she spends crowd-controlled, I'd hate to see Annie's stun only give the same benefit as Quinn's vault for three times the CC. So you have to stop her, but it just gets harder and harder to do, and she _just keeps coming._
Personally, I call her the "Pint-Sized Powerhouse".

Not really about her personality, but I've often described poppy as the "anti-tank anti-assassin tank assassin". :)
Fun champ... (for me - not so much for enemies or even my own team).

I always thought of her as a wrecking ball: tough and able to smash the things you need smashed.

As a Poppy main (she's probably 50%+ of my games played in the last 3 seasons) I can confidently say that kit-wise, she's definitely a "ball of not giving a single fuck" at the moment. She could also be classified as something like a "ball of death" or "ball of damage".

In term of personality (so VO, look, skins, SFX, playstyle, etc.), I feel that she's a bit of a "ball of self-righteous justice". First of all her selection quote (which is re-used as attack or move) : "Valoran will know Harmony" gives away her very dedicated personality. Other quotes like "My convictions will not falter", or "Their defeat is non-negotiable" reinfrce that.

Then, other quotes leads you to realize she's not only determined, but also slightly oppressive. She's clearly a diplomat who solves conflicts and all that... it's just that she solves them by flailing around and killing stuff (which is kinda ironic given that she's become that way because her father was killed for a puny theft). Lots of quotes point out that opprssive/violent nature like "They'll beg for peace", "Fighting is serious business", "Their defeat is non-negotiable" or "Let me demonstrate *hammer* diplomacy".

So basically, she's fighting for a justice she decided is the right one. Which actually really fits her kit given that she can simply choose a target/justice, and from there oppress the enemy team by flailing around and bashing faces in.

Also have you thought about making her more of a Juggernaut instead of a tank? As a Poppy player ideally I would like to see the following in the Poppy rework:

1. E being mostly retained
2. Q being mostly retained (including procing sheen)
3. Some sort of low health tankiness
4. Keeping a Juggernaut profile

Hey Scruffy! As a long time Poppy play and lover (I must've played 50% of my Ranked games on her for the last 3 seasons), there are a few things that I really fear about this rework, and a few other which intrigues me.

For a starter, what did you guys identify as her core gameplay elements? Right now, I feel liek all of her abilities are bland and/or problematic. W is barely interactive, Q is a simply AA reset move, and her innate is simply "being tankier". At the same time, her Innate is purely broken where no number tuning could make the ability feel good without being completely overpowered (like it is right now), her Q scales with pretty much everything (AD, AP and enemy max health),  her W is a shitton of stats that you can keep up fairly easily through lane, and I don't think I really need to point out the numerous flaws in her ultimate. So when faced with a kit that's so fundamentally broken, how do you proceed in term of reworking the champion?

Otherwise, in a similar fashion, Poppy also has *many* different playstyles she can opt to go for since her kit doesn't really enforce anything (high AP scaling, %dmg increase, %dmg reduction, CC, high base damage). I've seen AP glass cannon (which isn't actually great now that DFG is gone), AP bruiser, AD bruiser, full AD, full tank, on-hit/hybrid, support (triforce), support (true support)... I'm not even sure there's a single item I haven't seen built on Poppy apart fro mthe Hextech core and Bonetooth necklace, and I wouldn't bet on the former. It's safe to assume that she won't be as good at doing everything, so the question is, what playstyles/roles are favored by the new kit?

Lastly, for now, you mentioned how E is being kept, were there any work done to make it feel better? I feel like it is a really frustrating ability right now on live since the placement of both yourself and the target are very random when you stun them. Sometimes you'll hit the enemy over smaller ledges (like the Blue buff river ledge or the mid lane raptor one), sometimes you'll be stuck between your target and the wall, sometimes you'll bodyblock the enemy inside the wall, sometimes it won't stun. On top of that it can currently be canceled by both dashes and blinks, which means that you end up blowing your only mobility spell to end up out of position and without having closed the gap nor inflicted any damage. When you trade E for flash, it's somewhat ok, since even if you get harassed back, you blew an important cooldown, but getting denied by things like Akali/Yasuo/Amumu dashing to me, or Lucian simply using his 6s cd spell to not only not lose anything, but even gain better harass thanks ot his passive is kinda irritating. So was there any technical/behind the scene work done to make Heroic Charge slightly more reliable/rewarding?

My worry isn't that you're not keeping her ult (it's terribly designed) but that you're apparently reworking her into a tank. Right now, if you ask any poppy player what kind of champion she is, the answer would be a bruiser/assassin. She serves a similar role to Irelia or Jax, and that is *not* the same role that a tank serves. Her current kit has nothing in it that really says "this champion is a tank" aside from the ramping mechanic on her W, which is in practice not actually used because of the fact that you can activate the ability to instantly stack it. Past that, her passive is damage mitigation that gets *less* effective as you build tank items, her E isn't a particularly tank-centric ability, and her ult is like a more overpowered version of Tryndamere's ult.

That doesn't say tank to me, that says melee carry or light bruiser. I understand that most of her kit won't be remaining, which is fine, but I really hope you guys are able to keep her role the same, where that role is basically "melee carry with burst mitigation abilities". Poppy has *never* been a tank, and that's not how anyone who plays her views her role. Her role is somewhere in between Master Yi or Yasuo and Jax or Irelia. *Please* don't rework her into a crowd-control oriented tank with low damage and high durability/disruption, since that's really not what she is.

I see and am sad that they're trying to do that with her.

She's *not* a tank. She's a melee carry and every poppy player will tell you that. Changing a champion's role works when it's not clear what the role of that champion even is, as was the case with pre-rework Sion, but Poppy *has* a clear role right now, she just doesn't have a well designed kit.

Reworking Poppy into a pure tank because she visually looks like one and has *one* ability that fits a tank playstyle is like reworking Lux into a pure support because she kind of looks like she might be a support and has a shield. If a rework is going to totally change what kind of champion a given champion is, you may as well just delete them entirely and make something new because all that will remain is the name.
